entries: I am Kalashtar, born into the living, and of the dead. Their memories come to me in dreams, and at times their voices whisper in the silence of my mind. As long as I am alive - I am the bridge between the two states of being.

The Kalashtar are humans born in strange circumstances that connect them to spirits that have yet to move on from the material plane. Some are born in graveyards or during bloody wars - but the exact circumstances that lead to such connections to the dead are unknown. Kalashtar are often seen as wise, spiritual people for great compassion for others - but there is an unmistakable alien quality to the Kalashtar, as though they themselves may not fully be alive.

The spirits that follow a kalashtar can drive it towards many alignments. Most Kalashtar combine strong self-discipline with compassion for all beings, but some Kalashtar are drawn to evil by the spirits that whisper to them.
Kalashtar mature and age at the same rate as humans.

Kalashtar are usually born to non-Kalashtar parents, and therefore can have any name. However, some Kalashtar elect to take on titles to add to their name. Kalashtar, the cleric to which Kalashtar are named for - considered the first Kalashtar in recorded history - called themself 'the Reaper.' Examples of these titles include 'the Wretched', 'the Silent', 'the Holy', 'the Watchful', and 'the Messenger'.

entries.name: Hunted by Nightmares
entries: The dreams of the dead, even the righteous dead, are often wrought with terror, pain, and sorrow. A Kalashtar can sometimes dream about the memories of ambient spirits to gain insight to the area they are sleeping in. For this reason, Kalashtar often seek residences that are new, in neutral areas, that have not seen bloodshed - if only to have a good nights sleep.

entries.name: Spirit Bound
entries: Every Kalashtar has a connection to the spirits of the undead, a bond shared by other members of their bloodline. Kalashtar appear human, but their spiritual connection affects them in a variety of ways. Kalashtar have symmetrical, slightly angular features, and their eyes often glow when they are focused or expressing strong emotions.

Kalashtar can't directly communicate with spirits. Rather, they might experience this relationship as a sense of instinct and inspiration, drawing on the memories of the spirits when they dream. This connection grants kalashtar minor psionic abilities, as well as protection from psychic attacks. Some spirits are good and lawful, wishing to guide the Kalashtar to lead just and fulfilling lives - but some only wish to cause pain to the living. Work together with the DM to determine the nature of the spirits that haunt you. Typically, a Kalashtar knows the name and nature of their spirits, but some may know nothing of their spirits or the source of their psychic gifts, such as an orphaned Kalashtar raised among strangers.
The bond to the spirits of the dead can cause some Kalashtar to display unusual quirks. Consider rolling or selecting a trait from the Kalashtar Quirks table.

entries.caption: Kalashtar Quirks
rows: You try to understand the motives and feelings of your enemies.
You prefer using telepathy over speaking aloud.
You feel a strong drive to protect the innocent.
You apply dream logic to mundane situations.
You discuss things out loud with your spirits.
You suppress your emotions and rely on logic.
You are strongly influenced by the emotions of those around you.
You prefer to find nonviolent solutions to problems whenever possible.
You are haunted by warrior spirits, and will fight for any noble cause.
You are secretly worried that anyone you meet may be a ghost.

entries.name: Psychic Resilience
entries: You have resistance to psychic damage.

entries.name: Soulsong
entries: Your connection to your spirit allows you to magically transmit your thoughts to willing creatures within 120 feet of yourself. A contacted creature doesn't need to share a language with you to understand your thoughts, but it must be able to understand at least one language. Your telepathic link to a creature allows it to respond to you telepathically, but is broken if you and the creature move more than 120 feet apart, if either of you is {@condition incapacitated}, or if either of you mentally breaks the contact (no action required).

entries.name: Temperance
entries: You have advantage on all Wisdom saving throws.

entries.name: Umbral Presence
entries: You know the {@spell mage hand} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell unseen servant} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell augury} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast {@spell unseen servant} or {@spell augury} with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race). None of these spells require spell components when you cast them with this trait, and appear instead to originate from your manifested spirit.

Kitsune is an ancient race, one not often known to the mortal world, however shifts in the power structure have allowed for the race to return to the mortal plane without hiding what they are. Some areas still see them as legends to be feared, others hunt them, and few worship them. Ragnarok has allowed for a long since hidden bloodlines to live their lives freely and forced some to relocate.
Kitsune mature by their early twenties, when they cease to physically age, they normally live less than a century. The more tails a kitsune possesses, the further their lifespan expands.
Kitsune have one tail when they are born and gain an additional tail at 3rd, 5th, 7th, 9th, 13th, 15th, 17th, and 20th levels.

entries.name: Mistborn
entries: Mistborn Kitsune originated from a plane of Mist thousands of years ago, being the children of Inari and Fenrir. Within the plane they would be hunted down and consumed by mistwalkers and other beasts of fog. In order to elude such a cruel fate, they escaped their realm finding or fabricating bodies for their spirits and starting lives away from their home land. Some of them followed their mother Inari, while others forged their own paths. Those under Inari's leadership and guidance, resorted to possession as a way to acquire physical forms. They created a beautiful and powerful city though due to a clash with the Crimson Legion, their nation fell and soon after so did Inari, leading the survivors to scatter across the world approximately 4 years ago. Many of them are known for their cold and standoffish nature and tend to be logical and focused on survival.

entries.name: Spring
entries: After Ragnarok, the fey spring was recreated by Aurora and taken over by their new Queen Valorie Kayn. Many Kitsunes found a new home there becoming attuned to the season of spring, while others were born within it. Most Kitsunes prefer the calm lifestyle that the city of spring provides, although their curious nature and desire to indulge in new found joys leads some of them to different directions. Many of them are known for their charming nature and value the pleasantries of life.

entries.name: Celestial
entries: After Inari was felled approximately 4 years ago, her children scattered across the world, some of them remaining set in their ways, while others accepted the goddess Aurora as their new guardian. Aurora taught them kindness, care, but most of all balance, as their nature steadily became more celestial. In other cases, some worshippers of Aurora or people that find themselves in great need are rumored to have received a blessing, providing them with Kitsune-like characteristics and divine powers. Many of them are known for their selfless nature and bravery.

entries.name: Trickster
entries: The descendants of Kajika the Four Tailed Fox God, who later on went to join Aurora's Pantheon. They exist in different places of the world, although due to many legends and myths behind their existence certain nations view them with caution and hostility, often hunting them for the magical properties of their pelts. Thus, they are often forced to conceal their identities in order to protect themselves from harm. Many of them are known for their chaotic and adventurous nature.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid. You are also considered a fey for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be a fey.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition charmed} condition on yourself.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: Much like the foxes they resemble, kitsunes have heightened senses. You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Disguise Appearance
entries: With the use of illusion magic you can hide your tails, ears, fur and other distinct traits of your heritage in order to appear as a human. To discern that you are disguised, a creature can use its action to inspect your appearance and must succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check (DC 13 + your proficiency bonus) to see through the illusion.

entries.name: Origin
entries: Whenever you choose this race, you gain an additional benefit based on one of the following options of your Origin.

entries.name: Mist Form
entries: When you take damage, you can use your reaction to momentarily turn your body into mist, reducing the damage you take to 0. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Legacy of Niflheim
entries: You know the {@spell shape water} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell misty step} spell with this trait. Once you cast that spell with this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have of 2nd level or higher. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Every Rose Has Its Thorn
entries: As a bonus action, you can cause flower-filled vines to wrap around your body. These vines remain for 1 minute, until you die, or until you dismiss them as a bonus action. While these vines remain, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class, and you can use a bonus action to unleash a flurry of razor-sharp petals. When you do so, each creature within 10 feet of you to takes slashing damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your proficiency bonus. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Legacy of Spring
entries: You know the {@spell druidcraft} cantrip.

entries.name: Silver Tongue
entries: When you fail a Charisma check, you can choose to reroll it. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Legacy of the Divine
entries: You know the {@spell dancing lights} cantrip.

entries.name: Mastery of Life and Death
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend a number of hit points equal to your level to cause one creature of your choice within 30 feet of you to regain a number of hit points equal to twice the amount you expend. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Reactive Resistance
entries: When you take necrotic or radiant damage, you can use your reaction to dampen the incoming energy. When you do so, you have resistance to the triggering damage type until the start of your next turn. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: A Fox's Guise
entries: As an action, you can alternate between your humanoid form and a fox form. When you change to your fox form (Creature Type: Small Beast), your equipment merges with you and has no effect until you revert to your humanoid form. While in fox form, you can't cast spells that require somatic components. Your movement speed increases by 10 feet and you have advantage on ability checks and saves that use Dexterity as well as Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks. You gain disadvantage on any strength saves or checks in fox form. Your armor class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use class features while within this form.

entries.name: Bite
entries: While in fox form, you can use your canine jaws to make unarmed strikes that deal {@damage 1d6} piercing damage on a hit. When you attack with your jaws, you can use Dexterity instead of your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: Legacy of the Fool
entries: You know the {@spell minor illusion} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell mirror image} spell with this trait. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell invisibility} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast {@spell mirror image} or {@spell invisibility} with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Quick-Witted
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Deception} skill and the {@skill Stealth} skill.
